common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report performance issues ranging from slow response times and unresponsiveness to complete system freezes.  One user experienced a CPU spike to 70% on one processor, interfering with keyboard handlers.  Another user reported slow response in the Copilot chat feature after a recent update.  Additionally, users report an inability to connect to Pieces servers with an error message about cloud service connectivity.  Troubleshooting steps include checking internet connection, switching networks, and restarting Pieces OS.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Unable to Connect to Pieces Servers
related_issues.text:
Unable to Connect to Pieces Servers
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.6

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Since today, every client receives the following error in the AI chat:

> "I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network then try again. If that doesn't work please contact support."

This error occurs on various networks and in any models.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Restart PiecesOS.
2. Open the client application.
3. Enter any query in the AI chat.
4. Observe the error message.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing connectivity problems with Pieces OS and Desktop App across Windows and Linux.  Login failures, HTTP 500 errors on /os/sign_in, and "unable to reach cloud services" messages in AI chat are common symptoms.  Check local network connectivity, Pieces OS logs, and ensure the Pieces OS version is up-to-date. Further investigation into server-side issues may be required.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces for Windows performance issues and infinite loading
common_issues.description: Users report performance issues with Pieces for Windows, including slow response times, infinite loading of the copy button in VS Code extension, and high CPU usage (70%). Issues observed across different Pieces OS versions (10.0.1, 11.3.6.0, and current).  Uninstalling Pieces OS and Desktop, and restarting the machine are mentioned as potential workarounds. Further investigation needed to identify root cause and solutions.

common_issues.title: Pieces performance issues causing slowdowns and unresponsiveness
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance and system unresponsiveness with the Pieces desktop application and Pieces OS on both macOS and Windows.  High CPU usage is observed, sometimes reaching 70% on a single processor. Issues include slow response times, application lag, and interference with other keyboard handlers.  Troubleshooting steps such as hard resets and uninstalling/reinstalling have not resolved the problem. Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset.
related_issues.text: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset. ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.3.6 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. When i run pieces desktop app and pieces os. My macbook pro fan starts at the top speed which results to slows down my pc. I will add some details related to my macbook and pieces version with some screen shots. **Mac details -** Processor - 2.2 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7 Graphics - Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB Memory - 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 MacOS - 15.5 (24F74) Pieces Desktop version - 4.1.2 Pieces OS - 11.3.6 **Images for CPU and GPU Usage** Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance, unresponsiveness, and failure to clear LTM. Issues observed across Windows OS and latest Pieces versions.  One user experienced high CPU usage leading to system instability.  Troubleshooting steps like hard reset and reinstallation did not resolve the problems. Further investigation needed to identify root cause and solutions.

related_issues.title: LTM does not clear
related_issues.text:
LTM does not clear
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I've been using LTM 2 since launch without clearing it. Such an improvement over LTM 1 with regards to time to first token. However, I have started to feel that ttft was getting longerand longer, even on supposedly faster LLMs. Even if built to recall 9 months worth of data, it might not be optimal, which is fair. Note that I have edited both the list of apps allowed to provide context, as well as checked apps to get context from within a chat. But to no improvement. So I tried tp clear the all time LTM. On Pieces Desktop, I do not get feedback when I click the clear button, but the dialog box disappears after a while. It takes some time. When checking if LTM has been cleared by asking a question about what I did in the morning or last week, the copilot would answer it correctly.  I conclude the LTM has not been cleared. I deleted the chat and tried to clear it via Pieces OS, got direct click feedback and after a while a confirmation message. Retried the copilot and it still has context. I suppose this is not expected behavior. By the way, using clouds LLMs.

Any ideas?
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving performance issues in Pieces OS and Desktop App, especially on Windows, focusing on slow response times, unresponsiveness, and high CPU usage.
Investigate and address connectivity problems with Pieces OS and Desktop App, including login failures, HTTP 500 errors, and cloud service connectivity issues.
Improve VS Code extension by fixing the infinite loading issue with the copy button.
Address the issue of LTM not clearing properly in Pieces OS and Desktop App.
Provide clearer communication and documentation to users regarding troubleshooting steps for common issues, such as network connectivity problems and performance issues.
Monitor and analyze Pieces OS logs to identify and diagnose recurring issues and patterns.
Consider implementing performance monitoring and alerting to proactively detect and address performance degradations in Pieces OS and Desktop App.
Gather more data on user environments and configurations to better understand the factors contributing to performance and connectivity issues.
Prioritize bug fixes related to core functionalities, such as login and LTM management.
Improve error messages and provide more specific guidance to users when errors occur, such as the "unable to reach cloud services" message.
Investigate the impact of recent updates on application performance and stability.
Consider implementing a more robust logging system to capture more detailed information about errors and performance issues.
Develop automated tests to identify and prevent regressions in critical functionalities.
Improve the process for users to report bugs and provide feedback, including a more streamlined bug reporting form and clearer instructions.
Regularly review and update the list of known issues and FAQs to ensure users have access to the latest information.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through various channels, such as blog posts, social media, and in-app notifications.
Enhance support documentation with more detailed troubleshooting steps and examples.
Provide more training and resources to support staff to better equip them to handle common issues and escalate complex problems efficiently.
Consider implementing a user forum or community platform to facilitate peer-to-peer support and knowledge sharing.
Analyze support tickets and user feedback to identify areas for improvement in the product and support processes.
Track the resolution time for different types of issues and identify bottlenecks in the support workflow.
Regularly review and update support processes and procedures to ensure they are efficient and effective.
Implement a system for tracking and prioritizing bug fixes and feature requests based on user impact and frequency.
Consider using a dedicated bug tracking system to manage and track the progress of bug fixes and feature requests.
Establish clear service level agreements (SLAs) for different types of support requests and communicate them to users.
Regularly measure and report on key support metrics, such as resolution time, customer satisfaction, and ticket volume.
Use data and analytics to identify trends and patterns in support requests and proactively address emerging issues.
Continuously evaluate and improve support operations based on user feedback and performance data.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team and encourage feedback and suggestions for improvement.
Invest in tools and technologies to automate and streamline support processes, such as chatbots and automated email responses.
Explore the use of machine learning and AI to automate tasks such as ticket routing and issue classification.
Integrate support tools with other systems, such as CRM and product development platforms, to improve collaboration and information sharing.
Provide regular training and development opportunities for support staff to enhance their skills and knowledge.
Encourage knowledge sharing and collaboration within the support team through regular meetings, training sessions, and online forums.
Develop a clear escalation path for complex issues and ensure support staff are trained on how to escalate issues effectively.
Establish clear communication channels between the support team and other departments, such as product development and engineering.
Regularly review and update support policies and procedures to ensure they are aligned with business objectives and user needs.
Conduct regular customer satisfaction surveys to gather feedback on the quality of support services and identify areas for improvement.
Use customer feedback to drive improvements in the product and support processes.
Proactively identify and address potential support issues before they impact users.
Develop a proactive communication strategy to keep users informed about planned maintenance, updates, and other events that may impact their experience.
Monitor social media and other online channels for user feedback and potential issues.
Establish a process for regularly reviewing and analyzing support data to identify trends and patterns.
Use data and analytics to identify areas for improvement in the product and support processes.
Continuously evaluate and improve support operations based on user feedback and performance data.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team and encourage feedback and suggestions for improvement.
